column3: they carry out the natural process of decomposition. Like herbivores and predators
column5: meaning that they use organic substrates to get their energy
column6: carbon and nutrients for growth and development. While the terms decomposer and detritivore are often interchangeably used
column8: detritivores must digest dead matter via internal processes while decomposers can break down cells of other organisms using biochemical reactions without need for internal digestion. Thus
column14: since they must ingest nutrients and are unable to absorb them externally.The primary decomposers of litter in many ecosystems are fungi. Unlike bacteria
column16: most saprotrophic fungi grow as a branching network of hyphae. While bacteria are restricted to growing and feeding on the exposed surfaces of organic matter
